atten4.ptxt: A bolt without a torque specification is shown in the standard bolt chart (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR STAY ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: When using a new bolt:

s3.ptxt: Clean the threaded portion on the vehicle body with a non-residue solvent.

s2.ptxt: When reusing a bolt:

s3.ptxt: Clean the threaded portion on the vehicle body and bolt with a non-residue solvent.
Apply adhesive to the threads of the bolt.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Install the back door stay with the 4 bolts.

atten2.ptxt: Install the back door stay while holding the back door.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR STAY ASSEMBLY RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.
Use the same procedure for both back door lower stoppers.

s2.ptxt: Install the back door lower stopper with the bolt.
for Upper Side:

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure for both back door panel cushions.

s3.ptxt: Install a new back door panel cushion.

s2.ptxt: for Lower Side:

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure for both back door panel cushions.

s3.ptxt: Install a new back door panel cushion.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR GLASS CHANNEL LH

atten4.ptxt: When installing the back door glass channel LH, heat the vehicle body using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the vehicle body excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the vehicle body surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the vehicle body surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the vehicle body.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new back door glass channel.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the vehicle body.
Using a heat light, heat the channel.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the channel excessively.

s3.ptxt: Remove the peeling paper from the face of a new back door glass channel.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install a new back door glass channel.

atten4.ptxt: Press the back door glass channel firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR GLASS CHANNEL RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR WASHER NOZZLE SUB-ASSEMBLY (w/ Rear Wiper)

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 claws to install the rear washer nozzle.
Connect the hose.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CENTER STOP LIGHT ASSEMBLY (w/ Center Stop Light)

s2.ptxt: Connect the connector.
Install the stop light with the 2 screws.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CENTER STOP LIGHT COVER (w/ Center Stop Light)

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 claws and 2 clips to install the cover.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR WIPER MOTOR GROMMET (w/ Rear Wiper)

s2.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the entire inner surface of the wiper motor grommet.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure that grease is applied so that the grooves in the grommet are filled with grease, but not so that the hole of the grommet becomes clogged with grease.

s2.ptxt: Install the rear wiper motor grommet with the position mark facing upward as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR WIPER MOTOR ASSEMBLY (w/ Rear Wiper)

s2.ptxt: Install the wiper motor with the 3 bolts.
Connect the connector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY (w/ Rear Wiper)

s2.ptxt: Operate the rear wiper, and stop the rear wiper motor at the automatic stop position.
Clean the wiper pivot serrations with a wire brush.
Position the blade tip within the range shown in the illustration.

item.ptxt: Hold down the arm hinge by hand while tightening the nut.
Install the arm and blade so that the rear wiper blade is aligned with the ceramic line.

s2.ptxt: Operate the rear wiper while spraying water or washer fluid on the glass. Ensure that there is no interference between the blade and pillar.
Close the wiper arm head cap.
Attach the 4 clips to install the back door outside garnish.
Install the 3 nuts.
Install the back door outside handle with the 2 nuts.
Temporarily install the back door lock with the 3 bolts.
Tighten the bolts in the order shown in the illustration.
Attach the back door lock cable.
Connect the clamp and connect the connector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR TRIM BOARD ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Attach the 16 clips to install the back door trim board.
